gc.title: GC Manager
gc.description: A system for managing small groups.
gc.status: Under construction - link will be available soon

me.title: Hi, Dino here!
me.p1: I am a web developer with nearly five years of experience in the job market. During this time, my main focus has been frontend development; however, over the past two years, I have been dedicated to studying and building backend solutions, especially since I started college and became a student at
me.p2: My intention with this space is to share my experience through my journey and the projects I have been developing.
me.p3: If you would like to learn more about my work, please feel free to get in touch with me through my social networks. Best regards!

p1.partOne: A very common practice in church life is that its members gather in small groups for the purpose of relating, sharing experiences, learning about God, among other things. As the church grows, it becomes necessary to manage these groups in some way, and the most common way is to use a spreadsheet.

p2.partOne: GC Manager is a web application designed to facilitate the management of
p2.partTwo: of the Angelim Teresina Church and its campuses. It allows the creation, editing, and deletion of groups, user management, and access control through permissions, among other features.

p3.partOne: One of the main features of this system is the ability to generate banners with the information of a GC. Previously, this work was done manualy using the online tool
p3.strongText: and all information was entered manually, taking around 8 minutes per banner.

p4.partOne: Later, when I took responsibility for updating GC information and generating banners, I created a script using JavaScript and
p4.strongTextOne: the time to generate a single banner dropped to less than 1 second!
p4.partTwo: This script fetched GC information from a
p4.partThree: file exported from Google Sheets and generated images using
p4.partFour: and the Node.js File System module.

p5.partOne: This only solved part of the problem. Now, other people need to handle this management, hence the need for a system that facilitates this work and is readily available on the internet.

mvc.title: MVC Architecture (Model-View-Controller)
mvc.description: Clear separation of responsibilities between business logic, user interface, and data flow control, facilitating maintenance, scalability, and testability.

docker.title: Docker Infrastructure
docker.description: Isolated and replicable environment using Docker and docker-compose, ensuring consistency across development, testing, and production environments.

database.title: Database Versioning
database.description: Database structure changes managed through migrations, allowing version history, safe rollbacks, and synchronization between environments.

quality.title: Code Quality and Standards
quality.description: Use of Prettier, linting rules, and Conventional Commits to maintain consistent code style, avoid common errors, and improve collaboration.

tests.title: Automated Tests
tests.description: Unit and integration tests executed automatically to ensure system reliability and safer deliveries.

auth.title: Authentication and Authorization
auth.description: Secure authentication with encrypted passwords, permission-based access control, and protected routes.

extra.partOne: In addition to a well-organized architecture with context separation and test coverage (local and CI), the system already includes features such as authentication, user creation, migration management, and health checkss.
